definitions.definition: Foolishness that results from a lack of foresight or lack of practicality.
examples: It would be folly to walk all that way, knowing the shops are probably shut by now.

definitions.definition: Thoughtless action resulting in tragic consequence.
examples: The purchase of Alaska from Russia was termed Seward's folly .

definitions.definition: ( architecture ) A fanciful building built for purely ornamental reasons.
examples: A luncheonette in the shape of a coffee cup is particularly conspicuous, as is intended of an architectural duck or folly .

main_definition: Foolishness that results from a lack of foresight or lack of practicality.
secondary_definitions: Thoughtless action resulting in tragic consequence.
( architecture ) A fanciful building built for purely ornamental reasons.

definitions.definition: A clump of trees, particularly one on the crest of a hill (or sometimes on a stretch of open ground).

main_definition: ( largely obsolete outside place names ) A clump of trees, particularly one on the crest of a hill (or sometimes on a stretch of open ground).
